content.question: Which of the following best explains the impact of the International Monetary Fund <math alttext="I M F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>IMF</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> on Mexico as argued in the passage?

choices.label: Mexico rejected privatization efforts by the <math alttext="I M F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IMF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and returned to state socialism.
Mexico refused <math alttext="I M F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IMF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> demands to lower tariffs, which led to high inflation.

The <math alttext="I M F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IMF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> slowed Mexicoâ€™s path toward North American Free Trade Agreement (<math alttext="NAFTA" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NAFTA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) integration.
The <math alttext="I M F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IMF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> stabilized the Mexican economy, leading to access to global markets.

content.answer: The <math alttext="I M F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IMF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> stabilized the Mexican economy, leading to access to global markets.

unit.text: 5: Political and Economic Changes and Development

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how the author's argument or perspective relates to political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
